page.title: 03THE GROUSE MOOR -EDDERTON
page.content: In the moorlands near Edderton there are several breeding pairs of{grouse} although their numbers have been dwindling in recent years. As their staple diet is mainly young{heather shoots they are mostly found in the open moor.In spring they nest on the ground.They have excellent{camouflage so until they are disturbed they are very difficult to see when sitting in the heather.In the past few years large parts of the habitat of the grouse near Edderton has been planted with trees as they are more economic than grouse.However the local estate organises a shooting expedition on August the twelfth called{"The {Glorious Twelfth"}each year as this is the first day of the grouse shooting season.
